results.title: Pre-treatment and continuous administration of simvastatin during sepsis improve metabolic parameters and prevent CNS injuries in survivor rats.
results.text_hl: The CLP-@SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ showed a reduction in plasma cytokines and improvement in metabolic parameters and locomotor activity, followed by minor alterations compatible with apoptosis and @<m>DISEASE_Gliosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@astrogliosis@@@ in the hippocampus and prefrontal cortex.

citations.NLM: Catalão CHR, de Oliveira Souza A, Santos-Junior NN, da Costa LHA, Dos Santos JR, Alberici LC, Rocha MJA. Pre-treatment and continuous administration of simvastatin during sepsis improve metabolic parameters and prevent CNS injuries in survivor rats. Mol Cell Biochem. 2022 Nov;477(11):2657-2667. PMID: 35604517
citations.BibTeX: @article{35604517, title={Pre-treatment and continuous administration of simvastatin during sepsis improve metabolic parameters and prevent CNS injuries in survivor rats.}, author={Catalão CHR and de Oliveira Souza A and Santos-Junior NN and da Costa LHA and Dos Santos JR and Alberici LC and Rocha MJA}, journal={Mol Cell Biochem}, volume={477}, number={11}, pages={2657-2667}}

results.title: Repurposing of cholesterol-lowering agents in status epilepticus: A neuroprotective effect of simvastatin.
results.text_hl: We found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced CA1 reactive @<m>DISEASE_Gliosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@astrocytosis@@@, demonstrated by a significant 37% decrease in @GENE_GFAP @GENE_14580 @@@GFAP@@@-positive cells, and that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ prevented the @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal loss@@@ in CA1, demonstrated by a significant 42% increase in the @GENE_RBFOX3 @GENE_52897 @@@NeuN@@@-positive cells, as compared to the findings in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Kainic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007608 @@@kainic acid@@@-induced @DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@ treated by a saline solution.

citations.NLM: Hanin A, Roussel D, Lecas S, Baudin P, Navarro V. Repurposing of cholesterol-lowering agents in status epilepticus: A neuroprotective effect of simvastatin. Epilepsy Behav. 2023 Apr;141():109133. PMID: 36813661
citations.BibTeX: @article{36813661, title={Repurposing of cholesterol-lowering agents in status epilepticus: A neuroprotective effect of simvastatin.}, author={Hanin A and Roussel D and Lecas S and Baudin P and Navarro V}, journal={Epilepsy Behav}, volume={141}, pages={109133}}

results.title: Attenuation of astrogliosis and modulation of endothelial growth factor receptor in lipid rafts by simvastatin after traumatic brain injury.
results.text_hl: Attenuation of @<m>DISEASE_Gliosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@astrogliosis@@@ and modulation of endothelial growth factor receptor in lipid rafts by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ after @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@traumatic brain injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Wu H, Mahmood A, Lu D, Jiang H, Xiong Y, Zhou D, Chopp M. Attenuation of astrogliosis and modulation of endothelial growth factor receptor in lipid rafts by simvastatin after traumatic brain injury. J Neurosurg. 2010 Sep;113(3):591-7. PMID: 19895202
citations.BibTeX: @article{19895202, title={Attenuation of astrogliosis and modulation of endothelial growth factor receptor in lipid rafts by simvastatin after traumatic brain injury.}, author={Wu H and Mahmood A and Lu D and Jiang H and Xiong Y and Zhou D and Chopp M}, journal={J Neurosurg}, volume={113}, number={3}, pages={591-7}}

results.title: Administration of Simvastatin after Kainic Acid-Induced Status Epilepticus Restrains Chronic Temporal Lobe Epilepsy
results.text_hl: Therefore, we also investigated the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treatment on the extent of @<m>DISEASE_Gliosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@reactive astrocytosis@@@ after KA-lesion.

citations.NLM: Xie C, Sun J, Qiao W, Lu D, Wei L, Na M, Song Y, Hou X, Lin Z. Administration of Simvastatin after Kainic Acid-Induced Status Epilepticus Restrains Chronic Temporal Lobe Epilepsy PLoS One. 2011;6(9):e24966. PMID: 21949812

results.title: Simvastatin Inhibits Activation of NADPH Oxidase/p38 MAPK Pathway and Enhances Expression of Antioxidant Protein in Parkinson Disease Models
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ increased dopaminergic neurons and reduced protein @CHEMICAL_Tyrosine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014443 @@@tyrosine@@@ nitration and @<m>DISEASE_Gliosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@gliosis@@@ in the midbrain of @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D010300 @@@PD@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Tong H, Zhang X, Meng X, Lu L, Mai D, Qu S. Simvastatin Inhibits Activation of NADPH Oxidase/p38 MAPK Pathway and Enhances Expression of Antioxidant Protein in Parkinson Disease Models Front Mol Neurosci. 2018;11():165. PMID: 29872377
